derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent.: coined in French from Greek bios 'life' + opsis 'sight', on the pattern of necropsy

entry.def: A biopsy is the removal and examination of fluids or tissue from a patient's body in order to discover why they are ill.

means.word_mean: 1. examination of tissues or liquids from the living body to determine the existence or cause of a disease
